Here are some simple questions that can be answered based on the provided passage about Zuzana Justman:

Q1: Where was Zuzana Justman born?
A1: Zuzana Justman was born in Prague, Czechoslovakia (now the Czech Republic).

Q2: What is Zuzana's maiden name?
A2: Zuzana's maiden name is Pick.

Q3: How many brothers and sisters did Zuzana have?
A3: Zuzana had an older brother, Jiří Robert Pick, who became a writer and playwright.

Q4: What happened to Zuzana's father during World War II?
A4: Zuzana's father, Viktor Pick, was deported to the Auschwitz extermination camp where he was killed.

Q5: Who did Zuzana emigrate to with her mother after World War II?
A5: Zuzana emigrated to Argentina with her mother after World War II.

Q6: What is the name of Zuzana's first film?
A6: Zuzana's first film is "Terezin Diary" (completed in 1989).

Q7: What is the name of Zuzana's play that premiered at a staged reading in 2018?
A7: Zuzana's play is called "Waiting for Father".

Q8: How many children does Zuzana have?
A8: Zuzana has two sons, Philip and David, from a previous marriage.

Q9: Who is Zuzana's husband?
A9: Zuzana is married to the late Daniel Justman, a psychiatrist and psychoanalyst.

Q10: What is the name of Zuzana's theatre collaboration in 2006?
A10: Zuzana collaborated on a theatre production called "The Unlucky Man in the Yellow Cap" (in original Czech "Smolař ve žluté čepici").

Q1: Who is Petr Hájek?
A1: Petr Hájek was a Czech scientist in the area of mathematical logic and a professor of mathematics.

Q2: What institute did Petr Hájek work at?
A2: Petr Hájek worked at the Institute of Computer Science at the Academy of Sciences of the Czech Republic and as a lecturer at the faculty of mathematics and physics at the Charles University in Prague and at the Faculty of Nuclear Sciences and Physical Engineering of the Czech Technical University in Prague.

Q3: When was Petr Hájek born?
A3: Petr Hájek was born on February 6, 1940.

Q4: What awards did Petr Hájek receive?
A4: Petr Hájek received the Medal of the Minister of Education of the Czech Republic in 2002, the Medal of Merit, third grade, in the area of sciences by President of the Czech Republic Václav Klaus in 2006, and the doctor honoris causa from Silesian University in Opava in 2008.

Q5: What are some of Petr Hájek's notable publications?
A5: Petr Hájek co-authored "O dynamické logice" with Pavel Kalášek and Petr Kůrka in 1960, "The Theory of Semisets" with Petr Vopěnka in 1972, "Metoda GUHA: automatická tvorba hypotéz" with Tomáš Havránek and Metoděj Chytil in 1983, and "Metamathematics of First-Order Arithmetic" with Pavel Pudlák in 1993.

Q6: What is Petr Hájek known for?
A6: Petr Hájek is known for his work in mathematical logic, particularly in the area of fuzzy logic, and for his contributions to the establishment of the mathematical fundamentals of fuzzy logic.

Q7: Where did Petr Hájek study the pipe organ?
A7: Petr Hájek studied the pipe organ at the Academy of Performing Arts in Prague under Jiří Reinberger.

Q8: What position did Petr Hájek hold from 1992 to 2000?
A8: From 1992 to 2000, Petr Hájek held the position of chairman of the Institute of Computer Science at the Academy of Sciences of the Czech Republic.

Q9: Who was Petr Hájek's colleague in co-authoring "The Theory of Semisets"?
A9: Petr Hájek co-authored "The Theory of Semisets" with Petr Vopěnka.

Q10: What is the name of the book co-authored by Petr Hájek and Pavel Pudlák?
A10: The book co-authored by Petr Hájek and Pavel Pudlák is titled "Metamathematics of First-Order Arithmetic".

Here are some simple questions that can be answered based on the provided passage:

Q1: Who was the donor of the St. Vitus Madonna?
A1: The donor of the St. Vitus Madonna is believed to be either Jan of Jenštejn or Oldřich Zajíc of Hazmburk, brother of Zbyněk Zajíc of Hazmburk, the fifth Archbishop of Prague.

Q2: When was the St. Vitus Madonna painted?
A2: The St. Vitus Madonna was painted around 1395-1415.

Q3: What is the composition of the picture frame of the St. Vitus Madonna?
A3: The picture frame of the St. Vitus Madonna is decorated with medallions featuring half-figures of four patron saints of the Czech lands, as well as other details such as angels and gemstones.

Q4: What is the significance of the Eucharistic significance in the St. Vitus Madonna?
A4: The details in the picture, such as Jesus's nudity and his mother pressing her fingers into his skin, have Eucharistic significance, referring to Corpus Christi.

Q5: Are there any related works to the St. Vitus Madonna?
A5: Yes, there are several related works, including the Madonna of Lnáře, The Týn Madonna, and others.

Q6: Can you tell me more about the illumination in the missal of Zbyněk Zajíc of Hazmburk?
A6: The illumination in the missal of Zbyněk Zajíc of Hazmburk is a work from 1409 and features details such as illustrations and text.

Q7: Are there any later replicas of the St. Vitus Madonna?
A7: Yes, there are later replicas of the St. Vitus Madonna, including the Madonna of Jindřichův Hradec and the Madonna of Český Krumlov.

Q8: Where is the St. Vitus Madonna currently located?
A8: The St. Vitus Madonna is currently located in the National Gallery in Prague.
